data: It had come at last, the day of days, for the two great American universities; Harvard and Yale were going to play their annual game of football and the railroad station of Springfield, Mass., momentarily became more and more thronged with eager partisans of both sides of the great athletic contest.

'Way Down East
A Romance of New England Life
Grismer, Joseph Rhode, 1849-1922; Parker, Lottie Blair
